dialogue.string: 1�I hear about you a lot. People say you do much for Selbina.
1�I speak for the whole town when I say thank you. Thank you.
1�Thing is, the turtlebacks are on the move. Word is they're up to no good.
1�I'm itching to go smash them, but I can't leave the town defenseless.
1�Maybe you could go instead. What do you say?
1�Well?Of course.Sorry, but I can't.
1�Thanks. The turtlebacks often strike merchants headed to our village. Another caravan was attacked just the other day.
1�They fled, but two of them were taken prisoner.
1�The turtlebacks prowling outside came from Beadeaux. We think the merchants are held captive there.
1�Their names are Evrard and Serafin.
1�They say that the turtlebacks keep prisoners locked up tight. Somewhere in Beadeaux there should be such a place.
1�The merchants who made it here said that they were different from other turtlebacks. I hope that helps.
1�I hate asking others to do our job, but please, rescue the two captives. Their families need them.
1�Oh? Pity... I hoped you would say yes.
1�Oh, you again. Thanks for all you've done for us. We need all the help we can get.
1�No reports of trouble recently. For us, no news is good news!
1�They fled, but two of them were taken prisoner.
1�The turtlebacks prowling outside came from Beadeaux. We think the merchants are held captive there.
1�Their names are Evrard and Serafin.
1�They say that the turtlebacks keep prisoners locked up tight. Somewhere in Beadeaux there should be such a place.
1�The merchants who made it here said that they were different from other turtlebacks. I hope that helps.
1�I hate asking others to do our job, but please, rescue the two captives. Their families need them.
1�This is the mayor's mansion. Our mayor is a good man. Go inside and say hello.
1�The Valkurm Dunes is Selbina's territory, but our militia is too few to patrol it. It is sad, but you adventurers must keep the sands safe.
1�Have you visited the mayor's office yet? That Naillina knows so much about everything!
1�I've noticed an awfully suspicious-looking fellow visit town recently. Have you seen him?
1�Isacio used to be a knight a long time ago. I wonder what brought him here...
1�Zaldon has all kinds of tales to tell. But he's so stubborn your head will ache!
1�Gabwaleid actually knows a lot about fishing. He'll teach you whatever you need to know.
1�The inn's cook, Valgeir, whips up some fantastic dishes. I wish I had enough money to try one!
1�Mayor Abelard is more like a scientist than a politician. He's into some kind of research.
1�Vuntar's an earnest worker. Come to think of it, he's been working here as long as I can remember...
1�Melyon is so proud of his sheep, isn't he? He's thought up interesting names for them.
1�Romeo is always thinking up new ways to make money. And I think he's pretty good at it, too.
1�My name's Manfried and I'm a deputy along with Flandiace. Velema's our sergeant, and the three of us serve under Thunder Hawk.
1�My name's Manfried and I'm a deputy along with Flandiace. Velema's our sergeant, and the three of us serve under Thunder Hawk.
1�Well, well. Nice to see a new face. This your first time to Selbina?
1�Well, is it?Why, yes.No, I come here all the time.
1�Oh. I think you should go see the mayor.
1�His office is way over on the west side of town, atop the tallest hill.
1�Oh. By the way, it's a good idea to show your face to our mayor if you still haven't.
1�I'm Velema. I keep watch over the docks.
1�Is there a problem? See the mayor if you have any questions.
1�Visitors often ask me how to find the mines of Palborough. What could they want from its dark and twisting tunnels?
1�Hello there. Is this your first visit to our fine town?
1�Well, is it?Why, yes.No, I come here all the time.
1�Yes, I thought as much. You'd best head to the mayor's office.
1�Trot down towards the shore and take the first stairway. Turn right, follow the wall, and there it will be.
1�Is that a fact? I never forget a face. Oh well. Never mind.
1�Have you been to see the mayor? If not, you should!
1�Our village may be small, but so many stop here to rest on the road between Bastok and San d'Oria.
1�Sorry, the station is for militia personnel only.
1�If you're heading outside, remember that there's safety in numbers. Gather people of different talents to cover any weaknesses.
1�If you're here for the ship, the docks are straight down the stairs from here.
1�Herminia carries a wide selection of goods, and Torapiont is always available for your weaponry needs.
1�Welcome to the Shepherd's Muster.
1�...You're looking for someone?A Galka staying at this inn?
1�Well, if that's the case, he's standing right behind you.
1�...You poor adventurer, being made to steal  $???? from those horrid Beadeaux Quadav.
1�Welcome to the Shepherd's Muster.
1�What an amazing display of thievery!This is the first time I've even laid eyes on  $????. I don't know what to say... It's incredible.
1�...You're looking for someone again?A Galka staying at this inn?
1�Well, if that's the case, he's standing right behind you.
1�This inn's got the best menu anywhere, thanks to the master chef. He's been cooking for ages, and I doubt anyone comes close.
1�What's all this? I didn't order anything.
1�Who made this?It was Rycharde.I'm not sure.
1�What? Rycharde made this? Nothing of his is worth eating!Oh, why not? Just a taste...
1�What is this garbage!? It's hardly edible! I knew he couldn't cook!
1�Tell him something for me. Tell him he should give up cooking for good!
1�Well, I won't take anything until I know who sent it. Tell me!
1�What now? I've nothing to say to you. Good day!
1�You again! What is it this time? I'd rather die than eat any more of his grub!
1�What? You want me to cook something? I'm sure you're up to no good, but as a chef I can't turn you down.
1�Fine, then! I'll prepare your little dish, but first you must bring me the ingredients I require.
1�I'll need  $???? and  $????. Now, make haste!
1�Hmph. So you found them, did you? Fine! Come see me tomorrow. It should be ready by then.
1�Where are those ingredients? I cannot start without them!
1�Done! Now, take it and get out of here!
1�What, you again? Well, I'm not about to chastise you. Very well, I'll have a look. Give me a moment.
1�It's true he has improved. But still he fails to grasp the basics of cooking. There's more to it than haggling over ingredients!
1�Everything has a foundation, not just cooking. Making things good on the outside is easy; it is what's inside that counts.
1�Only when one has understood the basics can they make the inside good. Amateurs hurry the most; too often they focus on appearance.
1�Rycharde is the perfect example. He simply isn't the prodigy I hoped for.
1�He may be my son, but he'll never be a chef in my eyes. Well, that's a lecture not meant for you.
1�You gave it to him, did you not? Back when I started teaching him how to cook, I often had him use %???? in his dishes.
1�?%???? come cheaply of late. But that doesn't rule them out as ingredients.
1�You could also use pricey ingredients, and even though your utensils might be mediocre, your food will still come out tasting fine.
1�Delicious food is not made from fancy spices or cutlery. Nor does it come from any methodical analysis.
1�Indeed, nothing is more crucial than the desire to satisfy others with good food, and thinking up ways to do it.
1�If my son could only realize that, there may still be some hope for him.
1�What? I'm busy. Can't this wait till later?
1�What now? It's not done yet! Don't worry, my dishes are always ready on time.
1�What now? It's done, so leave me in peace!
1�Oh, you again. I hope you liked the dish.
1�You gave it to him, did you not? I do hope he understood.
1�Cooking is a complex art, but the basics are as clear as day. I suppose that goes for just about anything.
1�Never forget to give thanks at each meal. The hands of many work hard to bring us sustenance.
1�I'm Abelard, mayor of this village. It's so tiny, you see, that all I do is mediate when there are disagreements.
1�In my spare time I research the life of Gwynham, the man who charted the maps we all carry today.
1�He was an adventurer, like you. His travels took him far and wide, and slowly he fleshed out his maps.
1�One day I discovered that stone monuments bearing his words lie in various places all over the world.
1�It seems each monument carries a different quote. I'd love to rush out there and see them all, but it's tough at my age.
1�Say, maybe you could help me gather his words! Well, what do you say?
1�Well?Of course.Sorry, but I can't.
1�What a relief! Well, there's no time to lose! Let's get you started on one close by.
1�Take this clay to the monument in West Ronfaure, and press it firmly upon the inscription. Then, bring it back so I can print a copy for my collection.
1�Nobody seems to know exactly where to find the monument, so I suppose it might be difficult to find. Take care!
1�Is that right? Well, that's too bad. Come back if you ever have a change of heart.
1�At last! You've done it! You have my warmest thanks. Here, this is a reward for your effort. Don't expect too much from this old man, though, hehe.
1�Well? Do you want to bring back another one for me?
1�Well?Of course.Sorry, but I can't.
1�Actually, I don't know where the others are. You'll have to find them and make the impressions yourself. Good luck, and take care!
1�Is that right? Well, that's too bad. Come back if you ever have a change of heart.
1�Hello again! How's it going? Got the guts to go out and search for monuments yet? Sometimes they're a cakewalk, you know. What do you say?
1�Well?Of course.Sorry, but I can't.
1�Actually, I don't know where the others are. You'll have to find them and make the impressions yourself. Good luck, and take care!
1�Is that right? Well, that's too bad. Come back if you ever have a change of heart.

1�You don't know where to go next, eh? Well, I still don't have an impression from the monument in  �[West Ronfaure/East Ronfaure/La Theine/Valkurm/Jugner Forest/Batallia/North Gustaberg/South Gustaberg/Konschtat], you know.
1�What? How could you lose a big piece of clay!? Here, I'll give you another one. Now, take care!
1�Oh, I'm sorry, my friend, but I've already got this one, so try getting me a different one. Take care, now.
1�Ah, you're back! This isn't the one I asked for, but beggars can't be choosers! Here, it's not much, but take this.
1�Well? Do you want to bring back another one for me?
1�Well?Of course.Sorry, but I can't.
1�Actually, I don't know where the others are. You'll have to find them and make the impressions yourself. Good luck, and take care!
1�Is that right? Well, that's too bad. Come back if you ever have a change of heart.
1�You're back! And with the last one! Thank you so much, my friend. In return for your unwavering kindness, I give you this.
1�Well, it's good to see you again! My research is going quite well, thanks to you. I hope that map's been useful.

1�You don't know where to go next, eh? Well, I still don't have an impression from the monument in  �[Pashhow/Rolanberry/West Sarutabaruta/East Sarutabaruta/Tahrongi Canyon/Buburimu/Meriphataud/Sauromugue], you know.
1�I'm Abelard, mayor of this village. It's so tiny, you see, that all I do is mediate when there are disagreements.
1�A pira...entrepreneur associate of mine known as Gilgamesh has had your name on his lips the past several days.
1�He rescued a young woman adrift at sea, and she spoke quite highly of you when she woke up.
1�Finding you has removed one burden off my shoulders, but there remains yet another.
1�You see, Gilgamesh made a second request.
1�He's looking for %???? that can be procured from some of the large bees around the Crag of Holla or Crag of Dem.
1�You probably know what I'm going to ask.
1�Wrest three %???? from those buzzing menaces located around either of the two aforementioned crags.
1�Of course, your efforts will be duly rewarded.
1�Oho! You've brought them back safely, then?
1�Gilgamesh and his entourage've just arrived back in port.
1�My friend,   gathered these %????, just as you requested.
1�Excellent. I think adventurers would have a use for these.
1�I...I have a request. Don't breathe a word to the populace that I aided a known pirate.
1�Their activities aren't completely on the up-and-up, but as a port town, we still depend on them.
1�And while we're talking of aid, remember to use that item I gave you.
1�Isacio here in town will know what to do with it.
1�I'm sure it'll aid you in your travels.
1�Wrest three %???? from those buzzing menaces located around either of the two aforementioned crags.
1�Of course, your efforts will be duly rewarded.
1�Oh, that's right! I forgot to give you this. My memory must be failing me!
4�I'm Abelard, mayor of this village.
1�You say you're looking for Lady Leffine?
1�You're not the first to ask that question, but I'm sorry to say there's no one here by that name.
1�Even if you've been requested to do so, you shouldn't be poking around into other people's pasts.
1�What's that?So why am I trying to find out about Gwynham Ironheart, you ask?
1�Sure, I've been doing research into Ironheart's past, but...
1�That's not the same thing, ?[sonny/lass].I haven't got the slightest interest in his private life.
1�I already know all there is to know about him, in any case.
1�Have you heard of Lord Torresapet B Ordelle?It was feared he would die a demented death in Ordelle's Caves before he completed the map of those twisted tunnels.
1�He gathered the facts about Gwynham Ironheart's life into a single volume. I have the book right there.
1�It's just that... Before that book came into my possession, Gwynham's daughter, Enid, tore out several pages and threw them away.
1�I'm curious as to what was written on those pages, but I suppose there's a reason Enid removed them in the first place.
1�I guess I should respect that.Besides, I doubt anyone could find them anyway...
1�Have you heard of Lord Torresapet B Ordelle?It was feared he would die a demented death in Ordelle's Caves before he completed the map of those twisted tunnels.
1�He gathered the facts about Gwynham Ironheart's life into a single volume. I have the book right there.
1�It's just that... Before that book came into my possession, Gwynham's daughter, Enid, tore out several pages and threw them away.
1�I'm curious as to what was written on those pages, but I suppose there's a reason Enid removed them in the first place.
1�Th-these are the missing pages!Where did you find them!?
1�They were left inside Ordelle's Caves...?
1�If somebody left these pages on purpose, then we have a duty to read them. Seems that Enid didn't throw them away after all.
1�Hm?If I'm going to read these pages, then I should tell you where to find Lady Leffine?
1�Fair enough.As did the great Gwynham Ironheart, Lady Leffine passed away many years ago.
1�However, her son, Louverance, grew up to become a fine young man.Last I heard, he joined the Royal Knights of San d'Oria.
1�I haven't seen him visit his mother's grave lately, though.Has something happened to him, I wonder.
1�Speaking of which, there's another thing that's been bugging me.
1�Earlier, I had another visitor looking for Louverance.
1�It was a young Hume lady. Made some mention of Atarefaunet's Band.
1�In any case, she left Selbina after discovering Lady Leffine was no longer with us.
1�Is that all you wanted to know?Now if you don't mind, I'll get to reading these pages you retrieved.
1�Is that all you wanted to know?Now if you don't mind, I'll get to reading these pages you retrieved.
1�A girl by the name of Sanctia?Yes, I seem to recall a young lady blowing into town quite a while back, and then blowing straight back out.You've missed her, I'm afraid.
1�Didn't I tell you this already?It was a young Hume girl that mentioned Atarefaunet's Band, remember?
1�She said she was looking for some bounty hunter that had crossed that group of merciless cutthroats.
1�Talk around town says that Louverance was searching for the very same man...
1�She wanted to meet with someone that lived here a long time ago.
1�Seems she meant to ask him about some bounty hunter he was looking for...
1�Hm? The young lady was determined to find her way to the Tavnazian Archipelago?And you think she went to one of the caves in the Valkurm Dunes?
1�We've had a warning from a high-ranking Jeunoan official not to go anywhere near the vortex in that cave.
1�Rumors say that travelers drawn into its depths are never heard from again.You might be too late to save your friend.
1�Did the young lady really go into that cave in the Valkurm Dunes?
1�She's either extremely brave or extremely foolish to try and reach Tavnazia through that vortex.
1�I'm Abelard, mayor of this village. It's so tiny, you see, that all I do is mediate when there are disagreements.
1�At last! You've done it! You have my warmest thanks. Here, this is a reward for your effort. Don't expect too much from this old man, though, hehe.
1�Ah, you're back! This isn't the one I asked for, but beggars can't be choosers! Here, it's not much, but take this.
1�Welcome to the mayor's residence. How can I help you?
1�What would you like to know?You wanted an adventurer?About this town.About the shops and services here.Nothing.
1�I can tell you much about Selbina.
1�Which subject interests you?History.Geography.Industry.That's enough.
1�Very well. Selbina was established by Bastok as a haven for ships bearing Gustaberg ore. She soon grew into a thriving port town.
1�Selbina declared neutrality at the outbreak of the Great War and maintains her independence to this day.
1�Very well. Our fair town lies in the middle of Valkurm Dunes, here in central Quon.
1�Most of the coastline consists of dunes and shallows. Selbina stands atop the only suitable harbor.
1�Very well. Thanks to the harbor, industry in Selbina has prospered throughout the ages.
1�But airships are the wave of the future, so we are trying to develop local industries such as fishing and agriculture.
1�Please come back if you have any questions. Good day.
1�Very well. Here we have regional salesrooms of the Fishermen's and Weavers' Guilds, as well as an inn and the sea travel agency.
1�You can purchase weapons from Torapiont inside the inn, and local items from Dohdjuma in front of the warehouse.
1�Please come back if you have any questions. Good day.
1�Ah, you must be  .
1�Thank you for answering the summons. One of the mayor's confidantes has been asking for you.
1�Their medicinal properties are highly valued even during times of peace, and what with the recent strange happenings...
1�Best of luck!
1�Another adventurer in Selbina? I don't know where you come from, but you must be quite resourceful to make it this far out.
1�These days, folks like you spend every hard-earned gil on shiny new weapons and armor.
1�And then they just toss out their old onion-gear as if it were rubbish!
1�Why, my father always scolded me whenever I left trash about! Indeed, a true adventurer would not litter, and neither should you!
1�That's why I thought of a plan: I'd gather old, worn-out onion equipment and recycle them.
1�That's where you come in! Bring me five pieces of onion equipment, and I'll reward you for your efforts.
1�Yes, these will do nicely! Take this as a token of my thanks.
1�Remember, never just throw anything away. There is always a use for things!
1�Now, once I get these little onions mended and polished, I'll send them off for sale abroad. I'm sure new recruits will find them useful.
1�That's where you come in! Bring me five pieces of onion equipment, and I'll reward you for your efforts.
1�Why, my father always scolded me whenever I left trash about! Indeed, a true adventurer would not litter, and neither should you!
1�Remember, never just throw anything away. There is always a use for things!
1�Oh, sorry... I was lost in thought.
1�Don't mind me. I have a lot to think about and... Huh? Oh, you've heard about my ring, have you?
1�I dropped it near the pier and it just... It was so dear to me. I don't know what to do.
1�I'd give anything to get my ring back. Anything! But the ocean has swallowed it forever. It's lost.
1�Yes, what is this? Goodness gracious! My ring! You found my precious ring! Thank you! Thank you so much!
1�How could I forget my promise? This is but a mere token of my thanks, but take it; you've more than earned it!
1�I've been all over Vana'diel, but the inn here is my favorite. It's not the most luxurious place in the world, but I love the relaxed atmosphere.
1�These days we traveling merchants fight for our survival. But we can't just give up our livelihood. After all, things weren't always like this.
1�Oh, hello again. I can't believe I ever lost that ring. I won't let that happen again.
1�Hello, how have you been? Haven't seen you for some time.
1�Me? Yes, I'm doing fine, thanks. But my girlfriend's just not feeling well at all.
1�I don't think she's sick, so I'm just having her eat nutritious things and hoping she starts feeling better soon.
1�Well?Of course.Sorry, but I can't.
1�Thank you very much. He wanted  $????.
1�They say they're really hard to come by. Take care, and best of luck to you.
1�Is that a fact? I wonder who could have the time to help me...
1�They say they're really hard to come by. Take care, and best of luck to you.
1�Say, this is  $????! You found it. You really found it! Thank you so much! Now he can start on that dish!
1�This is all I have to give. Please, take it. You're our savior!
1�Oh, hello there. Thanks for helping me out then. My girlfriend was very grateful.
1�I thought that maybe the real culprit is food itself! Once you eat something, it's gone, right?
1�And that's when I came up with this great idea for my next present...but I'll need a little help getting it.
1�Well, what do you say? Could I call upon you for yet another favor?
1�Well?Of course.Sorry, but I can't.
1�I know I might seem stubborn, but you're my only hope.
1�Well, since you're such a fine fisherman, I wanted to ask you to find  $???? for me.
1�They say that %???? yield pearls. If I find one, I'm planning on having a boneworker fix it up for me.
1�Then I could give my girlfriend a fine pearl necklace. Well, don't you think she'd like it?
1�But without  $????, I can't even begin. I wish I knew where they could be caught. If I knew someone who could tell me.
1�I have a feeling you'll figure something out. Please, do what you can.
1�Oh, I see. But I really would prefer you! If you ever find the time to help me, please come back.
1�They say that %???? yield pearls. If I find one, I'm planning on having a boneworker fix it up for me.
1�Goodness, you found one! Thank you so much! Here, this is for you.
1�You're so fantastic! My girlfriend and I thank you from the bottom of our hearts.
1�Oh, hello again. Thanks for all you've done. My girlfriend was quite impressed with the necklace! The thing is, she said something rather odd.
1�She said, ??Thanks for the gift, but what I want the most is you here next to me.??
1�I didn't know what to say. Nobody's ever said such things to me!
1�Thanks to you, I feel like I've learned what's really important.
1�Now I know that she's the one. Thank you so much for all the help!
1�I've been all over Vana'diel, but the inn here is my favorite. It's not the most luxurious place in the world, but I love the relaxed atmosphere.
1�These days we traveling merchants fight for our survival. But we can't just give up our livelihood. After all, things weren't always like this.
1�Say, have you heard? Pirates roam the seas between Selbina and Mhaura. You watch out. One never knows when they'll strike next!
1�Orcs to the north, turtlebacks to the south... With the ocean now swarming with corsairs, our village is the only haven!
1�Been to Jeuno yet? They say that none may question the worth of a man who's walked to Jeuno.
1�What!? You want me to look for a ring? Oh, my! You ask the impossible.
1�Wait! Maybe Zaldon knows something. That old angler's the most knowledgeable man in this here whole village.
1�We work the docks. Trade ships couldn't sail without us, but I guess we'd starve without them, too.
1�Keep a sharp eye out for pirates. Word is they strike using uncanny powers. They say it's the truth, believe it or not.
1�I hear many Humes in Bastok look down on us Galka.
1�Nobody is like that here in Selbina. Here, race is no issue. All that matters is an open mind.
1�As you've no doubt discovered, this here village owes its life to the fish. Bless their hearts...
1�As you've no doubt discovered, this here village owes its life to the fish. Bless their hearts...
1�Our town is equally far from all the great nations. You can go to Bastok, you can go to San d'Oria--all roads are just as risky.
1�My husband's out fishing. Lots of good fish bite here.
1�Hmm... Of course, it's not impossible. But I wouldn't get my hopes up too high.
1�Listen. Around here, the %???? often bite. Heck, they'll swallow anything that sparkles.
1�There's a chance that one of them gulped the ring down. So, catch as many %???? as you can, and you just might find it!
1�Once you catch  $????, bring it. I'll cut it open for you.
1�Caught one, did you? Well, give me a second here. I'll cut it right open.
1�Well, tug my tail! I never thought you'd find it, but here it is!
1�Caught one, did you? Well, give me a second here. I'll cut it right open.

1�Support jobs are undertaken anywhere you normally change jobs. And you must already be proficient in a job before you can declare it your support job.
1�Furthermore, the effective level of your support job can never exceed half that of your main job. Also, since it is merely a support job, you'll never advance through experience.
1�I shall give an example. Let us say you have attained level 20 as a warrior and level 10 as a white mage. You would obviously declare your main job warrior, and your support job white mage.
1�In this example, you fight as a warrior of 20 levels and as a white mage 10 levels lower. Thus, you would be performing both jobs to their maximum potential.
1�In contrast, if you had declared white mage your main job and warrior your support job, things would be very different!
1�Since you would have only 10 levels of experience as a white mage, your potential as a warrior would be reduced to half that of your main job. Thus, 5! Not a wise decision, is it?

1�Similarly, you wouldn't want to make your support job something you've never done before. If your support job level is less than half that of your main job, your undeveloped skills would make not a difference. Remember this well!

1�Fish Ranking is a contest held periodically by the Fishermen's Guild. Participants compete based on a set of defined rules regarding the size and weight of a certain big fish.

1�To participate, you must acquire the fish we specified for the contest and bring it here. We won't look over your shoulder to see if you're catching your fish or buying them. That's your personal decision.
1�You can only have one fish entered for Fish Ranking at once. You can choose to overwrite your current entry with a new catch, but you won't be able to re-register your previous submission.
1�We will announce the results after the submission period ends. The top ten entries will receive a modest award and prize money, as well as a new title.
1�Fish are judged based on a set of predetermined rules.
1�The rules are simple. All fish are inscribed with their size (Im) and weight (Pz). The contest may be judged based on either number, or even both values added together.
1�Depending on the rules, the person who caught the fish with the lowest or the greatest value wins!

1�Value is determined by the calculation of ??points?? and evaluated based on the contest rules. For example, when the rules designate the ??smallest fish,?? the person with the fewest points will win.
1�During the submission period, I will inform everyone what criterion we are judging by, so just ask if you're curious!
1�If you would like to submit an entry, please trade the fish specified for the contest to me, and I will give it a rough inspection.

1�After you pay the registration fee, I will return your fish to you. All that's left afterwards is to wait for the results.
1�To ensure a fair contest, we will label your fish before returning it.
1�This will not affect the fish other than disqualifying it from reentry in Fish Ranking. You can still cook the fish, sell it at auction, or use it for quests.
1�After the submission period ends, the results will be announced. To view the ranking board, just speak to me.
1�Anybody may view the ranking board. You'll especially want to check if you or a friend participated in the last contest. Perhaps one of you will be listed on the board, too!
1�The top ten contestants will receive a modest award consisting of prize money from the Fishermen's Guild and a new title.
